text: Aroa yokoae is a moth in the family Erebidae. It was described by George Thomas Bethune-Baker in 1927. It is found in Cameroon.Afro Moths The wingspan is about 26 mm. Both wings are pale creamy yellow, with the termen edged very broadly (more than half the distance towards the cell) with blackish brown. The underside of the wings is like the upperside.Bethune-Baker, G. T. 1927. Descriptions of new Heterocera from Africa and the East. - Annals and Magazine of Natural History (9)20:321–334 ==References== Category:Moths described in 1927 Category:Lymantriinae Category:Moths of Africa
title: Aroa yokoae
